title: The real culprit for the so called "damage", "Crowd control" and "mobility" creep
body:
A lot of individuals on this board have stated that there is an overabundance of certain things in League of Legends.
I've seen complaints about there being too much crowd control, causing certain classes, mostly immobile melee ones, to feel like a chore to play due to them being pinned down without a lot they can do to circumvent that issue.

Additionally there have been some complaint about excessive damage and mobility, both of which are also direct results of the same thing causing the so called "CC creep".

And that thing is a certain stat called "Cooldown reduction."
______________________________

Cooldown reduction in previous seasons was a stat that people actively opted into on certain classes, or rather specific champions, requiring certain item builds and rune setups that would allow them to hit the cooldown reduction cap somwhere down the line.
There were specific high-budget items that allowed champions to get 40% cdr, with Frozen heart having been one of them.

Both the Iceborn gauntlet and the Trinity force did not have 20%, with Trinity force even having none of it in its previous iterations.
Whoever wanted to get cooldown reduction had to plan ahead and know which items to pick so that they would amass enough of the stat to hit the cap.

But this is no longer the case nowadays.
There has been an influx of a lot new CDR items, usually introduced during Class Updates.¨
The biggest offenders being {{item:3071}} {{item:3165}} and most Tank items, as they already provide a bulk of CDR in one purchase, effectively making people able to pick up a second or third item to reach the cap.
And that's without the tradeoff of less damage, durability or a lack of certain other stats.

Core items have been given a lot of CDR with a lot of staple items having smaller amounts of 10% per purchase that allows players to hit a 40% cdr cap relatively early into the game.

But is that necessarily a bad thing?
__________________________

In my opinion?
Yes, for a few reasons I shall put into perspective.

Prior to this influx of new CDR options a lot of champion's spells were balanced around having a high cooldown that meant that they had to be used sparingly or only in certain situations so that the spell would not go to waste.
This layer of strategic thinking was removed as a lot of spells have a rather high uptime due to excessive cooldown reduction numbers.

In previous seasons hard CC was usually just a one time thing. One high moment that would turn the tides of a fight but nowadays the same spell can be used more than once during a fight, meaning there's a lot of additional crowd control flying around in a messy teamfight.

Additionally damaging abilities and mobility have also been affected by this change, meaning that damage and mobility is higher.
A lot of mages in particular itemize Morellonomicon, already providing them with 20% cdr and making them able to use their spells several times more often than in older version of League of Legends.

________________________

Is there a way to combat this influx of CDR that is warping the battlefield of Summoner's rift?

Frankly?
Yes, indeed.

And it's rather easy.
It would simply require core items to have less Cooldown reduction on them and force champions to consciously invest in this particular stat without getting it passively through their core itemization.

Morellonomicon, Black cleaver, Iceborn Gauntlet and Trinity force in particular need some changes to their stats while other CDR items should have their niche of being geared towards higher spell uptime made more pronounced.
___________________

As a closing remark:
Yes, cooldown reduction is a fun stat to have as it allows you to sling more spells at the opposition and overall get to use your champion's abilities more often without having to keep them for certain threats.
But it does lead to the game losing a lot of its strategic thinking when hard crowd control is so readily available and certain damaging abilities become too overwhelming.

But reducing the builds that lead to 40 or 45% cooldown reduction would benefit this game heavily as it would turn down the overabundance of Crowd control and damage that many people seem to have a problem with while making the experience of playing League of Legends overall more enjoyable.

Actually, its the champion designs and reworks as of late. 

Most CC is knock-ups, not even affected by tenacity. 

Slows are tacked onto everything. 

Mobility is thrown on almost every new kit. 

________________

CDR is a very small part of CC/mobility creep, considering most people aimed for 40% CDR anyway. 

CDR contributes to damage creep much more heavily than CC/mobility, since people can itemize more damage in lieu of CDR-specific items.

__________

While I do agree that itemization should be changed to make CDR a trade-off, as opposed to free on items, don't get the contributing factors of the current game-state mixed up.

See here's the thing I don't understand though. If Champion design is the problem, what is the solution? Create more Master Yi's who don't have any Utility but damage? The reason we have mobility is so they're is more than one way to deal with an enemy than "Kill them first". Perhaps there is a fine line we can hit, but the reason slows are plentiful is because they allow power and skill expression. 

"Hit this, and get rewarded with sticking to your enemy". Take away the slow, and you need to pump more power into it elsewhere, into defense steroids, damage, mobility, something so they can compete with people. This in turns creates shorter trades, because you require less effort to do something effectively. 

I also think there is a small amount of "feeling", that comes with hitting and ability and watching them get slowed/stunned as well. A real "OOMPH", that your spell is so powerful, it staggers your opponent. 

Final point I want to ask though, which Champions do you feel have excessive mobility that isn't required for their kit/class? Kayn is an assassin, and needs to be slippery. Ornn needs a way to engage 1v1s and close gaps in teamfights, that isn't heavily telegraphed. Camille is a diver, Ivern's a wierd one, Rakan is meant to be an aggressive flashy support. 

In your opinion, which few of our champions/reworks have "Tacked on" mobility?
I guess Urgot (who's supposed to be a ranged juggernaut) is an example? His dash is so telegraphed that his dash is understandable, I think.

Maybe, but even then Juggernauts have some way of closing distances. Darius has his pull, Garen his sprint, Illaoi her ~~slam jam~~ jump, Skarner his speed boost, etc. Urgot is also an extreme case, with a mechanic that's very unique, with his kit built entirely around it. The dash's main purpose is not to be slippery, but to help Urgot switch to his back leg damage. An Urgot who holds on to his escape, loses out on damage.

>worse? My philosophy is a champion needs counterplay in teamfight
old sejuani had no counterplay in teamfight

I'd disagree that Sejuani had no counterplay in a teamfight, she had the same conterplay as pretty much any short ranged champion. Outside of her R everything on her kit required her to maintain melee range to be even remotely effective, so she was vulnerable to peel. She had the damage to down squishy champs, but there was no way for her to kill of tankier melees without assistance, so assuming you could keep her off your squishies her effect was fairly limited.

Conversely new Sej is much more effective at range, her W obviously has a far better range now and her E doesn't even require her to ever enter range assuming she has a melee ally because of this pealing and kiting her back just doesn't really work to the same extent that it used to. This is a significant and unarguable dropoff in counterplay.

>new one has counterplay in 1v1

I'd like to understand this argument but I don't think you actually have one. The only time when a 1v1 against Sej is ever going to be relevant (baring niche toplane builds) is when it's an early game invade. Since Sej doesn't lane she interacts less with the enemy team in a 1v1 sense. Old Sej typically lost almost every 1v1 in the early game due to her late game scaling nature, new Sej actually performs far better in early 1v1s and is certainly better at holding off until her team can reach her.

If you get caught out in a 1v1 late game against a Sej as a non-duellist champ you've already fucked up. Sej shouldn't be able to create this situation. She could theoretically splitpush to force a 1v1 but since she's a jungler there's already inherently good strategical counterplay to this. I just don't see very many times where Sej being stronger than average in a late game 1v1 was an applicable strength, had she have been a top laner who ran TP and was less reliant on teamfights then maybe, as it stood she just couldn't abuse that strength.

This is where the argument of "add counterplay" falls apart completely, when you actually go and break the rework down it becomes immediately clear that no significant counterplay was added while real counterplay was removed from her kit on mass.

>i don't have any preferences, my view is that sejuani needs a real rework

Real reworks take time and resources, two things Riot has already squandered in regards to Sejuani. A simple revert could be accomplished in a single patch (as seen with Kog'maw). So the argument becomes, assuming Riot doesn't have the resources for a full rework or they're better spent elsewhere which one of the two is better. I'm yet to see a convincing argument for new Sejuani over old Sejuani, you cite counterplay but your argument falls flat under the slightest of scrutiny from someone with actual understanding of how both kits worked as it's very clear that Sej lost counterplay in the rework.

From all other angles new Sej appears either equal to or worse than old Sej. She fits her thematic worse, she's less fun to play, worse to play against, more generic, doesn't offer anymore skill expression and is lower counterplay. I fail to see any reasonable argument which wouldn't land on the side of Old Sej being significantly better.

The way I'd solve the problem with CC is two fold. 1, make tenacity affect everything and be more meaningful. Knock-ups should not ever be excluded from CC and if a team if 5 knock-ups what do you do? Just give up because the one stat meant to beat CC is worthless.

The second way I'd do it is by applying the logic from Paladins where every instance of CC adds to this stack of CC. Whenever you are hit with CC directly after one instance of it, the new CC will be less effective. Basically if you have 3 stuns that last 2 seconds each it would work like;

First stun - 2 seconds
Second stun - 1.75 seconds
Third stun - 1.5 seconds

As an example. This is to prevent heavy CC stacking at the end of the day and league has probably the most instances of hard CC in any game I've played so this is just a really good solution to being CC locked by a lone Sejunai for about 4 whole seconds.

Another solution is make CDR more niche again. CDR is way to build into everything nowadays and if a person wants to build towards a stat, there should be a trade off. CDR doesn't. Simple as that. So let's solve that and make CDR less of a glut stat and more of a niche, you need to build towards stat.

Other things like dashes and mobility as well as damage are rooted in a lot of different things but I think CDR would heavily solve some of those issues while the CC fixes help out a lot of classes that are struggling.

What would actually happen with less CDR in the game:
Banshees Veil becomes much deadlier because it's more of a cost to break the shield. Morello is also less important as a Rush so the champions who don't have mana issues rush Veil early and use it to bully with impunity and all-in easily. 

Champions who need to build mana quickly fall out of favor as Morellonomicon is far worse than Banshees Veil. Mid lane becomes dominated by Ahri, LeBlanc, Katarina and Fizz. 

Team fights come around and the tanks initiate. Amumu throws his Bandage Toss!

Enemy team flashes away. Now Amumu is dead in the water for 9 seconds.

Enemy team engages and kills the carry in those 9 seconds. Nami is only able to cast each of her 10-14 CD utility abilities once before her team is wiped out.

And fun was had. That's why we play this game, to tap a few keys once each and then stare at a screen until it turns grey.

> Champions who need to build mana quickly fall out of favor as Morellonomicon is far worse than Banshees Veil. Mid lane becomes dominated by Ahri, LeBlanc, Katarina and Fizz. 

What. Ahri is most definitely reliant on Morello's. Otherwise her Mana issues become very apparent unless she's being fed constant Blue Buffs. At best she'd have to move to Lich Bane if Morello was dumpstered.

No-one's asking for no CDR, we're asking for CDR to be a significant tradeoff. For example if Morello's were to keep its CDR it should have its AP reduced to ~80 and a new item building from Lost Chapter could be introduced at the 120 AP range so there's actually a question of "is it better to get 40 extra AP or 20% CDR", just as an example.

Your argument is a ridiculous strawman of the most extreme case where we just removed CDR from every single item. We're not saying Amumu should always have to rely on his base 8 second CD Q, we're saying that an Amumu who chooses to opt out of CDR should get to be significantly tankier for doing so. Amumu could still build any % of CDR he wants, but for every 10% he doesn't buy he gets an extra 150 HP or 20 armour or something the like, so it may not always be best to rush 40% CDR since he could be significantly tankier if he didn't.

You're failing to understand Riot's position here though. With the spread of CDR to multiple items, they want players to feel like they have options for their itemization. They added CDR to {{item:3001}} and{{item:3194}} specifically so that you wouldn't feel like you had to buy {{item:3065}} just for the CDR. You aren't buying these items for their stats (unless you need mana), instead you're buying the item based on the passive that you want. 

So you are asking for CDR to be a significant trade off. But we've lived in that world in previous seasons, and people still went for CDR. Riot is instead devaluing CDR, making it less and less costly and willing to tack it onto anything. It's less about opting into CDR than it is that everyone's cooldowns slowly lower as the game time goes on. 

And again, people shouldn't be opting into having more burst or more tankiness anyway. Using abilities is straight up better than standing still. Tanks, mages and supports get almost nothing out of their auto attacks. They can ONLY contribute to fights with their abilities. Why would you want to be tankier than have more spam when you can't draw aggro? Being tankier can only help you if you survive long enough to cast your abilities again, in that situation you'd rather be slightly less tanky with slightly lower cooldowns. It's an idiotic request to give up CDR in order to live longer and MAYBE cast your abilities again.

Damage creep = really just Crit and a few new items bypassing too much armor sometimes.  Rework Crit, reduce effectiveness of Duskblade (internal cooldown on the damage application).

Mobility creep = match mobility of immobile champs with those of mobile ones through itemization that only works if you did not blink or dash recently.  Rather than reduce mobility make it available to everyone.

Crowd Control Creep = displacements are in too many kits, solve with skill expression itemization that allows players to ignore it for a short duration on a relatively short cooldown.  Marksmen already get a cleanse item and assassins have EoN, mages have Zhonyas, Tanks really do not have an item, neither do fighters (Mercurial/EoN is not very good on most of them).

CDR does not feel like the culprit to me, but being able to go over cap has been an issue.  CDR allows some champions to actually combo somewhat frequently, and being available to all keeps it pretty fair for everyone.  The issue is when players cannot use abilities or they simply are not needed because right clicking fully outscales abilities.

> Mobility creep = match mobility of immobile champs with those of mobile ones through itemization that only works if you did not blink or dash recently. Rather than reduce mobility make it available to everyone.
